channel.title: Best athletic achievement?
channel.description:
Title kind of says it all.
Please don't post things like "when i gets a 6 pack lul", I'm talking about one of those epic moments where there's 5 seconds left on the timer and you make a basket. It could be at anytime in any sport, including practice, etc.

item.title: Best athletic achievement?

item.description:

item.title: Best athletic achievement?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:57, topic:437052”][quote author=m1lkman link=topic=539768.msg3956533#msg3956533 date=1332804124]

Having pro senses and ducking while a frisbee was throw at my head with out seeing it. true story.

I would have to say being one of only two people at my school to win a wrestling match against a different school that has mostly 6-7 years people… It was my first and only year. Plus the kid was 6, 3 and 175 pounds… and I was 5, 7…

Size doesn’t matter in wrestling, just weight…? Right? Don’t see how height is an advantage, you’re on the ground for most of the time.
[/quote]more wing span[/quote]
Makes you more vulnerable to arm bars.

Read full topic

item.title: Best athletic achievement?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“XxAndyxX, post:51, topic:437052”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=539768.msg3953698#msg3953698 date=1332539577]
I once drank a bottle of absinthe while ejaculating violently over ten (!) different male and female bodies.
[/quote]

CRAZY IMAGE IN MY HEAD RIGHT NOW…[/quote]did you video it? <3 that is pretty cool of an image

[hr]

-Made varsity first year in wrestling (9th grade)]
-Learned the concepts of several programming languages
-fairly fluent in Spanish(four plus years of schooling on it)
-Drunk an entire bottle of bbq sauce for a bet xD…and won.

Read full topic

item.title: Best athletic achievement?
item.dc:creator: @Crown2 Crown2
item.description:
@Crown2 wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:28, topic:437052”][quote author=Crown2 link=topic=539768.msg3951893#msg3951893 date=1332361939]
When I Completed The IronMan Triathlon in 2 Hours

Iron Man Triathlon :

An Ironman Triathlon is one of a series of long-distance triathlon races organized by the World Triathlon Corporation (WTC) consisting of a 2.4-mile (3.86 km) swim, a 112-mile (180.25 km) bike and a marathon 26.2-mile (42.2 km) run, raced in that order and without a break. Most Ironman events have a strict time limit of 17 hours to complete the race, where the Ironman race starts at 7:00 AM, the mandatory swim cut off for the 2.4-mile (3.9 km) swim is 2 hours 20 minutes, the bike cut off time is 5:30 PM, and all finishers must complete their marathon by midnight.
[/quote]

I would’ve believed u if u just said you completed it[/quote]

Lol maybe in like 5 days if i don’t die on the way those people must practice a whole lot before doing something like that

Read full topic
